item.title: If you could go anywhere in the world, where would you go? Fulbright Information session
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 4, 2026 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - Students interested in doing graduate level research, seeking a degree, or teaching English for a year abroad, should attend this information session on the Fulbright U.S. Student program. Students that will have a bachelors degree by fall 2027 and are U.S. citizens are encouraged to attend. Many Master’s and PhD students conduct research abroad for their U.S. degree program. Register: https://surveys.rpi.edu/jfe/form/SV_6L3FFwv0qCROrvE For…

item.title: Smoothie Socials at the Heffner Alumni House
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 4, 2026 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM - All students are invited on the first Wednesday of the month for delicious smoothies and snacks. Connect with fellow students and the Alumni Engagement team. This month’s theme is Cozy and Connected: the first 50 students get free RPI fuzzy socks, and the flavor of the month is RPI Chai.

item.title: Lighting Research Center Open House - February 4
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 4, 2026 11:00 AM - 1:00 PM - The Lighting Research Center (LRC) invites Seniors and 5th-year students to an Open House on February 4 from 11:00-1:00 in the Gurley Building. Learn about the co-terminal lighting program, including a paid 3-month summer internship, tour the facility, and meet Program Directors and faculty. Open to students in physics, engineering, architecture, design, cognitive science, and more. Pizza and beverages provided! Please RSVP at the link…

item.title: Graduate Certificates Review with RPI at Work | Feb. 4
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 4, 2026 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Join RPI at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., in a 30-minute information session highlighting the whole range of RPI’s online, project-based graduate certificate programs. These certificates are three courses in length, developing targeted ability groups, and can be completed in as little as seven months.

item.title: Webinar Friday February 6: Carousel Digital Signage
item.description: Join Jim Evans, Director of MultiMedia Services, on Friday February 6 from 11am-12pm, for a hands-on training session and learn how to create and publish slides on RPI’s digital signage system, Carousel Digital Signage. Whether you’re promoting a lecture, club event, or campus initiative—this session will help you get your message on screens across RPI. Register now: https://rensselaer.webex.com/webappng/sites/rensselaer/webinar/webinarSeries/register/783d951c6ab8482e9198a7bd6075a700

item.title: Coming Soon! Staging Grounds Arts Festival
item.description: February 20-28, 2026 staging grounds Arts Festival 2026 is a platform of performances, open installations, and public programs. New commissions by Korakrit Arunanondchai and Jewyo Rhii, with additional artworks by Na Mira, Samson Young, and Li Yi-Fan explore how art, cultural memory, and experience are shaped by structures that re-animate events across time. Festival Korakrit Arunanondchai, Li Yi-Fan, Na Mira, Jewyo Rhii, and Samson Young
